The Breakthrough: The Cyber-Sentinel Agent

To fight a new class of AI-generated flaws, we need a new class of AI-driven defense. Our breakthrough is the Cyber-Sentinel Agent, a specialized evaluator designed not to find bugs, but to audit for intent.

A New Paradigm for Security

Our current security paradigm is broken. We cannot solve an AI velocity problem with more human review or more static scans. The Cyber-Sentinel Agent represents a new category of "AI-Native SAST" (Static Application Security Testing) that is built from the ground up to reason across users, data, and permissions, and to catch the subtle, context-dependent vulnerabilities that traditional tools miss.

The Three Pillars of Contextual Integrity

The Cyber-Sentinel Agent provides a holistic "Contextual Integrity Score" for any AI-generated code, based on three core pillars of measurement:

  • Rationale Integrity: Does the code's purpose align with the documented business rationale and human intent?
  • Architectural Integrity: Does the code adhere to the system's established architectural patterns and constraints?
  • Testing Integrity: Does the test suite validate the semantic intent of the requirements, not just achieve superficial line coverage?

Architecting Accountability

The Cyber-Sentinel Agent is built on a modern, multi-agent "Orchestrator-Worker" architecture. This "glass box" approach externalizes the agent's reasoning process, making it inherently auditable and accountable. This is not just a better way to build agents; it's a better way to govern them.
